context: A security incident was observed on the host `vnevado-win10v` where multiple dual-purpose tools were dropped. These tools could be used for credential theft, privilege escalation, and lateral movement. Among the files identified are `powershell.exe`, `mimikatz.exe`, `domaindominance27.ps1`, `rubeus.exe`, and `psexec.exe`. The user account involved is `tgs2z` with the SID `S-5-7-21-1843151660-3234030288-105586167-1422`.
question: There is also another dual-purpose tool that was identified in this alert. Can you find out what this additional file name is?
solution_steps: The attacker launched PowerShell with the command line `powershell.exe -executionpolicy bypass -file c:\users\tgs2z\downloads\domaindominance27\domaindominance27.ps1` on `2024-06-27T14:32:08.4041849Z`, with Process ID `4676`.
The file `psexesvc.exe` which is a known dual-purpose tool was dropped on the device.
